data.title: Bird Cage is Convenient
data.text: Our first stop for food after arriving in Ft Worth and it was wonderful.  The building was very interesting to see and the food was good.  Location was very convenient.

data.title: Good food/ friendly staff/ great porch view of the Square
data.text: Enjoyed a Sunday brunch (inside as it was raining) - enjoyed the food. Super nice waitress. Large outdoor porch for good weather and right on the Square.  Upstairs private room for parties and a small outdoor deck.  Older building w/interesting interior architecture. I would recommend- overall good experience.

data.title: "HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE....NEVER AGAIN"
data.text:
Arrived at the restaurant on time for our 5:45pm reservation.  Requested the patio and we were promptly seated.  Waitress was polite and took our drink orders.  We ordered caesar salad, cheese and meat tray, plus steak tartare.  We waited over 25 minutes for a dry, tasteless salad that virtually had no dressing and only croutons.  Not a good start.  We then waited over 30 more minutes for our entrees (neither required cooking).  Had to track down the waitress and she apologized for delay.  I stated we needed to leave in about 20 minutes due to another engagement.  She said she was not sure if she could get the food to us in time.  I told her to just bring me a check for the drinks and salad.  She then returned with the food in a to go bag and informed us that the manager comped the food.  I had to throw my food away as I had to nowhere to store raw meat.  My girlfriend opened her meal and saw the meat and cheese included bologna (unbelievable)!!

I personally rank this as one of the WORST dining experiences ever in my life and we eat out a LOT!  I strongly encourage everyone to find somewhere else to eat when in Sundance Square Fort Worth! Like for example late that night after our event we returned to Sundance Square and had a very nice dinner at Del Frisco's Grille.  So advice is to find a good place other than Bird Cafe.  They need to learn how to run a restaurant better than they are doing right now!

data.title: Great for brunch
data.text: A large group went here for brunch we sat outside looking at the park and fountain.  It was delicious. The selection was very good and unique.  The Bloody Marys were both very good. Everyone really enjoyed their meal!

data.title: The Pot Pies brought us in!
data.text:
Very easy to make an on-line reservation via open table.  Requested an outdoor table for 2.  We were dressed casually and when we arrived were promptly seated outside.
Couldn't wait to have the potpies, but they were sold out of both, so I had the steak frites, Hubs had a burger and we shared the collards.  Meal was good.
I loved the building-huge indoor seating area as well as upper seating.  It was fun to just walk around and look at the artwork and structure of the building.  Had fun watching the fountains and all the coming and goings on Sundance Square.
One complaint-I wasn't thrilled seeing a woman sitting with her shoes off, bare feet up on a chair.  That's a bit too casual even for outdoor dining on a Saturday night.

data.title: Good lunch spot
data.text: Located on the sundance square so you can sit outside while enjoying your meal.  Menu is focused on different birds, as the name suggests. Recommend the quail dish for an appetizer.

data.title: Great food awesome coffee average service
data.text: I had this delicious fried chicken breast atop grits with jalapeno gravy and two green poached eggs on top--it was extraordinary!  The servers were friendly but forgetful, absent-minded and not really attentive.  Really tasty food--great location and nicely decorated.  My wife and I enjoyed it.

data.title: Excellent dinner in a pleasant atmosphere
data.text:
I have been here twice now, and it's a great place on Sundance Square.  We ate outside in front of the restaurant--my only beef is that the tables are REALLY small.  We had trouble fitting the plates on the table.

The food is uniformly excellent.  The salads are fresh and tasty.  I enjoyed the beet salad, with both beets and a good amount of greens, nicely dressed.  The mussels are also very good--the Belgian version is particular, with awesome garlic butter.  The fried cod and chips was also very good--moist fish nicely battered with crisp fries and a side of peas.  

The wait staff made a few minor mistakes, but quickly and cheerfully fixed them.  There is an excellent wine list as well.  Besides the small tables, my only other complaint is that it is not cheap.  However, it remains a great place to take a date.

data.title: Sunday Brunch
data.text: The Bird Cafe offers a delightful Sunday brunch experience.  Diners can choose to eat indoors or on the patio.  The service was extraordinary.  We opted for a pitcher of mimosas which were the best I have ever had.

data.title: Great waitress and location-ok food
data.text: Loved my beet salad and my friend loved her fall salad but other than that we were underwhelmed by the food.  Tried meat and cheese board, ribs, chicken lolly pops and mussels.  Everything was fine but not inspiring.

data.title: Celebration dinner
data.text: We brought my mother in law here for her birthday. It was a nice dinner and she really enjoyed it. We love supporting independent restaurants over a chain. It's in a beautiful historic building in downtown Fort Worth beside Sundance Square. This is a birthday worthy restaurant. We're already making plans to return when my brother in law comes to town again. Food, I talk and nothing about the food. We ordered small plates, hummus, shrimp and grits, asparagus and my favorite, risotto. I think next visit. I will try the mussels. They were calling me tonight.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Yum!! We went to te Bird Cafe to have drinks on a Saturday evening. We went to the roof top patio, which over looked the square. We loved it so much, we came back for brunch the next morning. We arrived before it opened and there was already a line! We were seated quickly despite the wait. We ate outside. The food was amazing!! The service was awesome. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us recommendations on his favorite menu items. We WILL be going back the next time we are in Fort Worth!

data.title: Special lunch
data.text: This restaurant is in the historic Sundance Square in downtown Fort Worth TX.  IT IS VERY NEAR THE ARTS DISTRICT , Bass Hall and the symphony.  Understated elegant atmosphere with outdoor seating for nice days.  My friend and I chose to try Bird Cafe for lunch.  The seating and service were very prompt.  Relatively small menu for lunch, but a good variety of items.  We chose a chicken salad croissant and a Reuben-like Pastrami sandwich.  Both sandwiches were huge.  Chicken salad served with a delicious house salad with glazed pecans and goat cheese.  The Reuben was served with house made potato chips....crispy and delicious.  Our waiter Wei was attentive and professional.  This place is a little pricey, but considering the size of our meals, I'd suggest sharing!

data.title: Nice Place
data.text:
This restaurant is on Sundance square with seating both inside and out. we were a party of 8 and were seated inside. The menu was pricey and limited but the food was very good.

Minor complaint was that i was the only person to order steak (well done) and everyone else had finished their meals before mine came - not nice eating on your own.

Would eat here agin but certainly not order the steak.

data.title: Great food with outdoor seating on Sundance Square
data.text: I took my husband to dinner for his birthday and we sat outside in the cover seating area under a ceiling fan and were very comfortable for a 90 degree day.  Our server was very attentive and brought us the happy hour menu as well as the dinner menu and very lengthy wine and drink menu.  We started with a Happy Hour Special that had three of the Stick Meats: Tandoori Lamb, Grilled Steak Asada and Seared Ahi Tuna.  Our favorites were the tuna and lamb.  We tried the Moth Balls as our Share Plate. They are ricotta cheese rolled in flour to make a pasta shell, covered with a white sauce and drizzled pesto.  It was good, but we will try a different share plate next time.   I had the Bird Green Salad as an entree'. I loved the goat cheese and the champagne strawberry vinaigrette!  My husband got the special which was ROASTED DUCK BREAST!  It was a very large portion and he let me have a few bites.  It was one of the best duck dishes we have ever had, including the ones we have had in Europe!  He was the first to order the special for the evening.  The server said that everyone was stopping her to find out what was on the plate as she carried it to our table.  To top off the evening, we were served a warm chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream, drizzled with more chocolate and local Avoca coffee from a French press.  Happy Birthday Honey! This was our first visit, but will not be our last.  Mondays are half price wine night!

data.title: Lunch adventure
data.text: Fell upon this place after renting bikes at the Stockyard and riding to downtown. I loved the salad that was on special for the day. It was composed of watercress, arugula, plum, grape tomatoes, cucumber, feta and a flavorful vinaigrette. Tastey, fresh and delightful! My husband had the One Eyed Jack sandwich. We both cleaned our plates. Our waiter, Jason, was fantastic!

data.title: Bird Cafe
data.text: This is a great place for a meal in the center of the busy area known as Sundance Square in Fort Worth.  There are great seats inside, both upstairs and down, as well as outside.  Service is good and prices are reasonable.  The menu is consistently broad with a few chalkboard specials nightly.  The concept of sharing is gradually catching on and the small plate selection at Bird helps.  Take a moment to walk around looking at the many framed paintings of birds hanging on the walls.  Like a gallery tour with dinner!

data.title: Come on in, It's not for the birds
data.text: The name has everything to do with ART (on the wall), not the menu.  If you haven't been here, be sure to listen to the waiter explain the ordering process - it's smaller plates to be shared so it's "pick 3" type menu ordering.  No worries, you won’t eat like a bird – you’ll leave satisfied. Restaurant has a nice patio with view of square; which was bustling with activity.  We had good, friendly service and the food was delicious.  Prices are on the upper mid-range, but again you’re sharing.  Certainly worth a return visit.

data.title: Getting the gang back together.
data.text: Went with a group of friends and ordered several "to share plates" and passed them. Our server was great as she paced the meal and did not bring everything out at once. Cocktails food and wine were all great and enjoyed many things not found at other restaurants. Great place to catch up with friends and enjoy some good food and drinks.

data.title: Great Brunch!
data.text: Stayed near Sundance Square this weekend and looked for a nice brunch.  We had great service...the Bad... Bacon Waffles were excellent!  Great menu for brunch with reasonable prices.
